column1: LIFs and ports for cluster peering
For each node in the cluster, you need the IP addresses of two intercluster LIFs, including a network mask and a default gateway. The intercluster LIFs are used to peer the clusters.
You must synchronize the time, which requires one or more NTP time servers.
You must enable access to the service processor of each node for troubleshooting and maintenance, which requires the following network information for each node:
Site B switch information (if using a switched cluster)

When you cable the system, you need a host name and management IP address for each cluster switch. This information is not needed if you are using a two-node switchless cluster or you are using two-node MetroCluster configuration (one node at each site).
